1.text: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

2.text: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

3.text: When his candle shined on my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

4.text: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was on my tabernacle;

5.text: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

6.text: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

7.text: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

8.text: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

9.text: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

10.text: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.

11.text: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

12.text: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

13.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came on me: and I caused the widowâ€™s heart to sing for joy.

14.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

15.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

16.text: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

17.text: And I broke the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

18.text: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

19.text: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night on my branch.

20.text: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

21.text: To me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

22.text: After my words they spoke not again; and my speech dropped on them.

23.text: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

24.text: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

25.text: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelled as a king in the army, as one that comforts the mourners.
